evidence.text: the Court GRANTS Petitioners’ Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order.

extracted.value: The court granted Petitioners' Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order on April 21, 2025, prohibiting the transfer of Petitioners and members of the provisionally certified class outside the District of Colorado and requiring 21-day notice for removal under the Alien Enemies Act.

evidence.text: the Court GRANTS Petitioners’ preliminary injunction motion.

extracted.value: The court granted Petitioners' Motion for Preliminary Injunction on May 6, 2025, prohibiting Respondents from transferring Petitioners and members of the certified class outside the District of Colorado and requiring 21-day notice for removal under the Alien Enemies Act.

evidence.text: the Tenth Circuit denied Respondents’ emergency motion for a stay pending appeal of the Court’s temporary restraining order on the grounds that Respondents failed to meet their irreparable harm burden.

extracted.value: The Tenth Circuit denied Respondents’ emergency motion for a stay pending appeal of the Court’s temporary restraining order on April 29, 2025, because Respondents failed to meet their irreparable harm burden.

evidence.location: Case No. 1:25-cv-01163-CNS Document 51 filed 05/06/25 USDC Colorado pg 1 of 23
evidence.text: The Court GRANTS Petitioners’ class certification motion, certifying the class Petitioners seek to represent: All noncitizens in custody in the District of Colorado who were, are, or will be subject to the March 2025 Presidential Proclamation entitled 'Invocation of the Alien Enemies Act Regarding the Invasion of the United States by Tren de Aragua' and/or its implementation.

extracted.value: The court granted Petitioners' Motion for Class Certification on May 6, 2025, certifying the class: 'All noncitizens in custody in the District of Colorado who were, are, or will be subject to the March 2025 Presidential Proclamation entitled 'Invocation of the Alien Enemies Act Regarding the Invasion of the United States by Tren de Aragua' and/or its implementation.'
